Tromp University of Groningen E L SE V IE R REGULAR ARTICLES Switchable ROS formation inhibits lignin Î² -O-4 models over-oxidation by CdS modified 2D g -C 3 N 4 for highly efficient and selective producing aromatic monomers under visible light Pengrui Â Zhang , Chuan Â Wang , Xuele Â Geng , Jiyuan Â Xu , Feng Â Song , Hongchang Â Pei , Ning-Ning Â Zhang , Jian-Ping Â Zou , Hongyou Â Cui and Hongzi Â Tan 116007 Construction of electron-rich nickel single atom catalyst by heteroatom doping for enhanced CO 2 electroreduction Jiale Â Sun , Kaiqi Â Li , Zhen Â Liu , Junwei Â Xu , Ping Â Gao , Meng Â Wang , Yifei Â Li , Rilong Â Zhu , IvanÂ P. Â Parkin and Zhongyuan Â Huang 116020 Guided by the DFT calculation results, the asymmetrical nickel single atom doped with phosphorus atom was successfully fabricated by phytic acid modification and calcination treatment. The doping of phosphorus atoms in the first shell modulates the valence state of nickel centres to make them electron-rich, which leads to optimised intermediate adsorption, electron transfer, lower reaction energy barrier and finally leads to excellent ECR performance in H-type cell, flow cell and Zn-CO 2 battery.
